page.title: 08Church Life in Sheering
page.content:
There is only one church in Sheering and it is called St Mary's.The present Rector and his wife have lived in Sheering for 14 months. Two services are held every Sunday at 8.30 and 10.30 which are attended by 50 to 70 people. A Sunday School for children aged 3 to 12 years is held every week and 22 children attend regularly. A Club called Seekers for children aged between 11 and 15 years is held every Thursday evening and attended by 8 to 10 children.
On alternate Tuesdays there is a regular meeting for people of all ages to talk about topical subjects. A home group is held every Wednesday at the Rectory. Mothers Union meets once a month at the Rectory. Some people from Sheering attend Roman Catholic and non-Anglican churches.
